Privacy Policy

Last updated July 1, 2023

Acknowledgment

This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by Lawson Web Development and how it is used.

This Privacy Policy applies only to online activities and is valid for visitors to the Website with regards to the information that they shared and/or collect while using the Lawson Web Development Website and/or Service. This policy is not applicable to any information collected offline or via channels other than this Website.

Contact

If You have additional questions or require more information about this Privacy Policy, email info@lawsonwebdevelopment.com.

Interpretation

The words of which the initial letter is capitalized have meanings defined under the following conditions. The following definitions shall have the same meaning regardless of whether they appear in singular or in plural.

  • Lawson Web Development is a sole proprietorship operated by Rachel Lawson. Mentions of Lawson Web Development are synonymous with Rachel Lawson.
  • Service refers to the contracted work and goods provided to the Client by Rachel Lawson.
  • You and Client means the individual (or company) accessing or using Services provided by Rachel Lawson.
  • Privacy Policy refers to this Policy that outline the use of personal information and data while using the Service or Website.
  • Third-Party refers to any person, service, business, or other entity other than Lawson Web Development.
  • Website refers to Lawson Web Development, accessible from https://lawsonwebdevelopment.com

1. Consent

By using the Lawson Web Development Website and/or Services, You hereby consent to this Privacy Policy and agree to its terms.

2. Collected Information

The personal information that You are asked to provide - and the reasons why You are asked to provide it - will be made clear to You at the point that You're asked to provide Your personal information.

During use of the Website and/or Service, additional information about You such as Your name, email address, phone number, the contents of the message and/or attachments You may send, and other information You choose to provide may be collected.

3. Use of Information

Your information may be used in various ways, including to:

  • Communicate with You regarding provided Services
  • Send promotional emails with special deals and information
  • Provide requested Services such as web development and design

Lawson Web Development will never sell Client's data, nor intentionally share it with Third-Parties without the consent of the Client. If data breaches occur, Lawson Web Development will make every effort to inform those affected in a timely manner.

4. Log Files

Lawson Web Development follows a standard procedure of using log files. These files log visitors when they visit websites. All hosting companies do this and a part of hosting services' analytics. The information collected by log files include internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet Service Provider (ISP), date and time stamp, referring/exit pages, and possibly the number of clicks. These are not linked to any information that is personally identifiable. The purpose of the information is for analyzing trends, administering the site, tracking users' movement on the Website, and gathering demographic information.

5. Third-Party Advertising

Lawson Web Development does not participate directly with Third-Party ad servers or ad networks, cookies, or other data-collecting methods. If such data collection occurs automatically, that data will not be used or intentionally kept my Lawson Web Development. Lawson Web Development has no control or access to advertisements or cookies used by Third-Party advertisers.

6. Third-Party Data Collection

Lawson Web Development holds no responsibility or control over how Third-Party services use Your data, even if those Third-Party services are directly linked on the Website, provided to the Client, or involved in the Service. Lawson Web Development recommends reading the Privacy Policy and Terms of Service for all Third-Party services used in relation to the Service provided to the Client.

7. CCPA Privacy Rights (Do Not Sell My Personal Information)

Under the CCPA, among other rights, California consumers have the right to:

  • Request that a business that collects a consumer's personal data disclose the categories and specific pieces of personal data that a business has collected about consumers
  • Request that a business delete any personal data about the consumer that a business has collected
  • Request that a business that sells a consumer's personal data, not sell the consumer's personal data

If You make a request, Lawson Web Development has one month to respond to You. If You would like to exercise any of these rights, please email info@lawsonwebdevelopment.com.

8. GDPR Data Protection Rights

To make sure You are fully aware of all of Your data protection rights, please review the following rights that every user is entitled to:

  • The right to access: You have the right to request copies of Your personal data
  • The right to rectification: You have the right to request that any information You believe is inaccurate be corrected, and request that any information You believe is incomplete be completed
  • The right to erasure: You have the right to request that Your personal data be erased, under certain conditions
  • The right to restrict processing: You have the right to request restriction of the processing of Your personal data, under certain conditions
  • The right to object to processing: You have the right to object to processing of Your personal data, under certain conditions
  • The right to data portability: You have the right to request that Your collected data be transferred to another business entity - or directly to You - under certain conditions

If You make a request, Lawson Web Development has one month to respond to You. If You would like to exercise any of these rights, please email info@lawsonwebdevelopment.com.

9. Information of Minors

Lawson Web Development does not knowingly collect any Personal Identifiable Information from children under the age of 18, and does not allow anyone under the age of 18 to participate in the Website or Service. If You think that Your child provided this kind of information on the Website, You're strongly encouraged to contact Lawson Web Development directly so this information can be removed.

10. Changes to This Privacy Policy

Lawson Web Development has full rights to update the Privacy Policy at any time. Clients can request to be notified when the Privacy Policy is updated by emailing info@lawsonwebdevelopment.com.
